summary: The document is a memorandum from J. Barry Harrelson, the JFK Project Officer, to several CIA officials, dated 15 January 1998. It details the agenda for an upcoming ARRB meeting on 22 January 1998, focusing on items such as the reconsideration of the State Cover, the status of Office of Personnel files within the sequestered collection, and the handling of non-related files/documents. Additionally, it mentions potential discussions on ARRB requests and reports concerning crypt and Castro assassination plots. The memorandum underscores the importance of coordinating with the Agency before any public release of information.
key_findings: The ARRB meeting agenda includes discussions on the relevance and release timing of various documents related to the JFK assassination.
Personnel files and non-related documents are proposed to be declared Not Believed Relevant (NBR) with their release postponed until 2017.
The Agency prioritizes privacy concerns over public interest in the release of certain files.
ARRB staff may seek the release or sanitization of DO documents pertaining to the assassination.
An updated version of the 1967 IG report on 'Castro Assassination Plots' is requested for release by the end of January 1998.
